ground_truth: The Colonel looks coldly down at us from Ricky's bedroom window, then pulls the drapes shut. Cars zoom past in the rain while Carolyn sits behind the wheel, listening to a motivational tape on the stereo. Carolyn leans over, opens the glove compartment, and takes out her Glock. Jane stands across the room, and Angela is sprawled across the bed as there is a knock on the door. Jane jumps up, opens the door, and lets him in. Angela stares at him, stunned, then starts toward the door and exits, slamming the door behind her. Jane turns to Ricky, and he takes her in his arms. Angela sits on the stairs, shaken and crying. We move slowly toward the Burnham's garage window through the rain. Through the window, we see Lester, wearing only his sweatpants, performing bench presses, and the Colonel standing outside, watching. We zoom slowly in on the Colonel as he watches, transfixed. Lester finishes his last rep, racks the weights, sits up sweaty and out of breath, and then glances at us, aware he's being watched. Lester and the Colonel stare at each other through the window as we're directly outside the garage door, slowly revealing Lester smiling at us. The rain comes down in sheets with a sharp clap of thunder. The Colonel moves stiffly, seems preoccupied and slightly disoriented, and just stands there looking at Lester before moving closer and grinning. Lester grins as well and places his hand on the Colonel's shoulder. The Colonel closes his eyes and then kisses him. Lester is momentarily stunned and then pushes the Colonel away. The Colonel's face crumples in shame as he stares at the floor, blinking, then turns and runs out the open garage door into the rainy night. Carolyn is still listening to the same motivational tape, holding the Glock in her hand, before she switches the tape off and puts the gun in her purse. The Mercedes pulls away from the shoulder. Lester enters, opens the refrigerator, grabs a beer, opens it, and starts toward the family room. Lester leans against the wall and takes a swig of his beer. As we move slowly around a corner, Angela comes into view, standing at the stereo, holding a CD case. She's been crying; her face is puffy, and her hair is mussed. She regards us apprehensively, then puts on a slightly defiant smile. Angela smiles as Lester holds the bottle up to her mouth and she drinks clumsily. He gently wipes her chin with the back of his hand.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: The Commander regards icily down at us from Ricky's chamber opening, then draws the curtains closed. Vehicles speed past in the shower while Carolyn rests behind the steering wheel, hearing a self-help tape on the sound system. Carolyn inclines over, unfastens the glovebox, and extracts her Glock. Jane stands opposite the space, and Angela is stretched across the mattress as there is a rap on the entrance. Jane leaps up, unseals the entrance, and allows him in. Angela gazes at him, astonished, then proceeds toward the entrance and departs, slamming the entrance behind her. Jane turns to Ricky, and he embraces her in his arms. Angela perches on the steps, rattled and sobbing. We move slowly toward the Burnham's carport opening through the shower. Through the opening, we observe Lester, clad only in his sweatpants, executing bench lifts, and the Commander standing outside, observing. We zoom slowly in on the Commander as he observes, captivated. Lester completes his final repetition, racks the weights, sits up sweaty and breathless, and then glances at us, conscious he's being observed. Lester and the Commander gaze at each other through the opening as we're directly outside the carport entrance, slowly revealing Lester grinning at us. The shower descends in torrents with a sharp crash of thunder. The Commander moves rigidly, seems absorbed and slightly confused, and just stands there looking at Lester before moving nearer and grinning. Lester grins as well and lays his hand on the Commander's shoulder. The Commander closes his eyes and then kisses him. Lester is momentarily astonished and then pushes the Commander away. The Commander's face crumples in disgrace as he gazes at the ground, blinking, then turns and sprints out the open carport entrance into the rainy darkness. Carolyn is still hearing the same self-help tape, holding the Glock in her hand, before she switches the tape off and places the gun in her handbag. The Mercedes departs from the shoulder. Lester enters, opens the icebox, seizes a brew, opens it, and starts toward the family space. Lester leans against the partition and takes a sip of his brew. As we move slowly around a corner, Angela appears, standing at the sound system, holding a CD cover. She's been sobbing; her face is swollen, and her hair is tousled. She regards us warily, then puts on a slightly rebellious smile. Angela smiles as Lester holds the bottle up to her mouth and she drinks awkwardly. He gently wipes her chin with the back of his hand.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: The Colonel is looked at coldly by us from Ricky's bedroom window, and then the drapes are pulled shut by him. Cars are zoomed past in the rain while a motivational tape is listened to by Carolyn behind the wheel on the stereo. The glove compartment is leaned over by Carolyn, and her Glock is taken out by her. Jane stands across the room, and Angela sprawls across the bed as a knock is heard on the door. Jane jumps up, opens the door, and lets him in. Angela stares at him, stunned, and then she starts toward the door, exiting and slamming the door behind her. Jane is turned to by Ricky, and she is taken in his arms by him. Angela is sitting on the stairs, shaken and crying. We are moved slowly toward the Burnham's garage window through the rain. Through the window, Lester is seen by us, wearing only his sweatpants, performing bench presses, and the Colonel stands outside, watching him. We are zoomed slowly in on the Colonel as he is transfixed by watching. Lester finishes his last rep, racks the weights, sits up sweaty and out of breath, and then he glances at us, aware he's being watched. Lester and the Colonel stare at each other through the window as we are directly outside the garage door, slowly revealing Lester smiling at us. The rain is coming down in sheets with a sharp clap of thunder. The Colonel stiffly moves, seems preoccupied and slightly disoriented, and just stands there looking at Lester before he moves closer and grins. Lester grins as well and places his hand on the Colonel's shoulder. The Colonel closes his eyes and then kisses him. Lester is momentarily stunned and then pushes the Colonel away. The Colonel's face crumples in shame as he stares at the floor, blinking, then he turns and runs out the open garage door into the rainy night. Carolyn is still listening to the same motivational tape, holding the Glock in her hand, before she switches the tape off and puts the gun in her purse. The Mercedes is pulled away from the shoulder. Lester enters, opens the refrigerator, grabs a beer, opens it, and starts toward the family room. Lester leans against the wall and takes a swig of his beer. As a corner is moved around slowly by us, Angela is seen coming into view, standing at the stereo, holding a CD case. She's been crying; her face is puffy, and her hair is mussed. She regards us apprehensively, then a slightly defiant smile is put on by her. Angela smiles as the bottle is held up by Lester to her mouth and she drinks clumsily. Her chin is gently wiped by him with the back of his hand.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: The Colonel gazes coldly from Ricky's bedroom window, then closes the drapes. Cars speed by in the rain while Carolyn listens to a motivational tape, retrieves her Glock from the glove compartment, and holds it. Jane and Angela are in the room when a knock sounds. Jane answers the door, and Angela, shocked, exits hurriedly. Ricky embraces Jane. Angela sits on the stairs, crying. We approach the Burnham's garage window through the rain to see Lester, in sweatpants, bench pressing as the Colonel watches. Finished, Lester notices us, aware of being observed. Lester and the Colonel stare at one another, then smile. The Colonel awkwardly approaches and kisses Lester, who, surprised, pushes him away. The Colonel, ashamed, runs into the rainy night. Carolyn, still listening to the tape, puts the Glock in her purse and drives away. Lester enters, opens a beer, and heads to the family room, where Angela, teary and disheveled, stands by the stereo. She smiles defiantly as Lester offers her a drink and gently wipes her chin.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: The Colonel coldly stares at us from Ricky's window, then shuts the drapes. Cars speed by in the rain while Carolyn listens to a motivational tape. She retrieves her Glock from the glove compartment. Jane stands in the room; Angela sprawls on the bed. A knock; Jane opens the door. Angela, stunned, exits and slams the door. Jane embraces Ricky. Angela, shaken and crying, sits on the stairs. Outside Burnham's garage, Lester bench presses in sweatpants as the Colonel watches. They make eye contact; Lester smiles at us. Thunder claps. The Colonel, preoccupied, approaches and kisses Lester, who pushes him away. The Colonel, ashamed, runs into the rain. Carolyn switches off the tape, puts the gun in her purse, and drives away. Lester retrieves a beer and leans against the wall. Angela, having cried, with puffy face and mussed hair, stands at the stereo. She smiles defiantly as Lester offers her beer, which she drinks clumsily, and he wipes her chin.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: The Colonel peers coldly and with a distant demeanor down at us from the window of Ricky's bedroom, then methodically pulls the drapes closed, shutting us out. Outside, cars speed by quickly in the relentless rain as Carolyn sits quietly behind the wheel of her car, focused on the motivational tape playing on the stereo. She leans over carefully, opens the glove compartment with a practiced motion, and retrieves her Glock. Across the room from her, Jane stands while Angela is stretched out across the bed. There is a knock on the door, breaking the silence. Startled, Jane jumps up quickly to open the door and allows him entry. Angela, visibly stunned upon seeing him, starts moving toward the door and exits abruptly, slamming it shut behind her with force. Jane then turns her attention to Ricky, and he embraces her warmly in his arms. Meanwhile, Angela sits on the stairs, visibly shaken, her tears flowing as she cries. We move slowly, deliberately toward the garage window of the Burnham residence, viewing it from the perspective of the rain. Through the window, we can see Lester, clad only in his sweatpants, working out by performing bench presses, while the Colonel stands outside watching him intently. Our view zooms in slowly on the Colonel as he continues to observe Lester, as if transfixed by the scene. Lester completes his final repetition, racks the weights with precision, and sits up, sweaty and out of breath, before he glances toward us, fully aware that he is being watched. Lester and the Colonel maintain a mutual gaze, staring at each other through the window. We are positioned directly outside the garage door as we slowly reveal Lester smiling at us. Rain pours down heavily in sheets, accompanied by a sharp clap of thunder that resonates through the night. The Colonel appears to move stiffly, as if he is lost in thought and slightly disoriented, just standing there looking at Lester before he approaches closer, grinning. Lester returns the grin and places his hand gently on the Colonel's shoulder. The Colonel closes his eyes briefly and then kisses him. Lester, momentarily taken aback and surprised, pushes the Colonel away. The Colonel’s face crumples in a wave of shame as he stares at the floor, blinking rapidly, before turning and fleeing out the open garage door into the dark, rainy night. Meanwhile, Carolyn is still attentively listening to the same motivational tape, gripping the Glock in her hand, before she switches it off and places the gun into her purse. The Mercedes then pulls away smoothly from the shoulder. Lester enters the house, opens the refrigerator with a casual air, grabs a beer, opens it, and makes his way toward the family room. He leans against the wall, taking a swig of his beer thoughtfully. As we move around a corner slowly, Angela comes into view, standing by the stereo, holding a CD case in her hands. Her face is marked by tears; it’s puffy, and her hair is tousled. She regards us with apprehension, then manages to put on a slightly defiant smile. Angela continues to smile as Lester brings the bottle up to her mouth, and she drinks clumsily from it. He gently wipes her chin with the back of his hand, a comforting gesture.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: The Colonel, maintaining a frigid and detached demeanor, peers intently down at us from the elevated position of Ricky's bedroom window. His gaze is cold and distant as he methodically draws the drapes closed, effectively shutting us out and severing the view. Outside, the unrelenting rain batters the streets as cars zoom by swiftly. Carolyn remains seated quietly behind the wheel of her stationary vehicle, her focus absorbed by the motivational tape playing softly on the car stereo. With a practiced and careful motion, she leans over smoothly, opens the glove compartment, and retrieves her Glock. Across the room, Jane stands while Angela is languidly stretched out across the bed. The tranquility is shattered by a sudden knock at the door. Startled by the noise, Jane quickly springs up to open the door, allowing him to enter. Angela, visibly taken aback upon seeing him, starts moving decisively toward the door and exits with urgency, slamming it shut behind her with considerable force. Jane then shifts her attention to Ricky and finds comfort as he warmly envelops her in his arms. Meanwhile, Angela sits on the stairs, visibly shaken and distraught, with tears streaming down her face as she cries. Our perspective shifts slowly and deliberately toward the window of the Burnham residence garage, observing through the lens of the pouring rain. Inside, we see Lester, clothed simply in his sweatpants, engaged in a workout, diligently performing bench presses. Outside, the Colonel stands, intently observing Lester as if transfixed by the scene unfolding before him. Our view steadily zooms in on the Colonel, who remains fixated on Lester and his exertions. Lester completes his final repetition with precision, racks the weights, then sits up, dripping with sweat and short of breath. He glances knowingly toward us, fully aware of being under observation. Lester and the Colonel engage in a mutual gaze, staring directly at one another through the window. Positioned directly outside the garage door, we gradually reveal Lester offering us a subtle smile. The rain continues to pour heavily in relentless sheets, accompanied by a sharp, resonant clap of thunder reverberating through the night. The Colonel moves stiffly, as if lost in thought and slightly disoriented, just standing there, his eyes locked on Lester before he approaches closer, a grin forming on his face. Lester returns the grin, his demeanor gentle as he places a comforting hand on the Colonel's shoulder. The Colonel briefly closes his eyes, then suddenly kisses Lester. Lester is momentarily taken aback, surprised by the gesture, and he gently pushes the Colonel away. The Colonel's face contorts, crumpling under a wave of shame. His gaze drops to the floor, blinking rapidly, before he turns and flees out the open garage door into the dark, rainy night. Meanwhile, Carolyn continues to listen intently to the motivational tape, her grip firm on the Glock, until she decisively switches it off, placing the gun securely into her purse. The Mercedes then pulls away from the roadside smoothly, merging into the rain-drenched night. Lester eventually makes his way back into the house, opening the refrigerator casually to grab a beer. He opens it deftly and heads toward the family room, leaning thoughtfully against the wall as he takes a considerate swig. As our perspective shifts around a corner, Angela comes into view, standing beside the stereo with a CD case clutched in her hands. Her face is marked by tears, puffy from crying, her hair tousled with emotion. She regards us with a blend of apprehension and defiance, managing to summon a slightly defiant smile. Angela continues to smile, even as Lester brings the beer bottle up to her mouth, and she drinks from it clumsily. He gently wipes her chin with the back of his hand, a tender, comforting gesture.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: The Colonel casts a cold, emotionless gaze down at us from Ricky's bedroom window, maintaining this stern demeanor before he deliberately reaches for the drapes and pulls them shut with a swift motion. Outside, the rain pelts down relentlessly as cars zoom past, their headlights cutting through the downpour, while Carolyn sits composedly behind the wheel of her parked car, deeply absorbed in a motivational tape playing on the stereo, its words resonating in the enclosed space. Amidst the rhythmic patter of rain on the windshield, Carolyn methodically leans over to her right, her hand extending towards the glove compartment, which she opens with a precise, practiced motion. She reaches inside, her fingers closing around the cold, metallic surface of her Glock, which she extracts with measured deliberation. Meanwhile, across the room, Jane stands on one side as Angela lies sprawled on the bed, an air of contemplation mixed with nonchalance about her, when a sudden, unexpected knock reverberates through the room. The sound prompts Jane to jump up with a start, and she quickly crosses the floor to the door, her hand reaching out to grasp the doorknob, turning it with anticipation as she opens the door and Ricky steps in. Angela, caught off-guard by Ricky's entry, fixes a stunned gaze upon him, her surprise momentarily rendering her motionless. Gathering herself, she abruptly rises from the bed and moves with determined purpose towards the door, flinging it open and leaving the room in a whirlwind of emotion, punctuated by the definitive slam of the door behind her. With Angela's departure, Jane turns her attention to Ricky, who responds by enveloping her in his arms, creating a moment of warmth amidst the surrounding tension. On the stairs, Angela sits, her composure unraveling as she succumbs to tears, her body shaking with the intensity of her emotions. The perspective shifts as we slowly approach the Burnham's garage window, the rain providing a watery curtain obscuring our view until we peer inside to find Lester clad only in sweatpants, his muscles straining as he performs bench presses with unwavering focus. Outside, the Colonel stands motionless, his attention fixated on Lester, as we gradually zoom in, capturing the Colonel's rapt expression as he watches, seemingly transfixed by the scene unfolding before him. As Lester completes his final repetition, he racks the weights with a metallic clink, sitting up with a heaving chest, glistening with sweat and visibly out of breath. He pauses in this position, and his gaze shifts toward us, his awareness of being watched evident in his expression, prompting a silent exchange of looks between Lester and the Colonel through the window. As we position ourselves directly outside the garage door, Lester's face lights up with a knowing smile directed at us, even as the rain intensifies, sheets of water descending with a sharp clap of thunder echoing in the background. The Colonel, appearing stiff and slightly disoriented, remains rooted to his spot, his thoughts seemingly elsewhere as he continues to watch Lester, before he edges closer with an enigmatic grin slowly spreading across his face. Responding in kind, Lester mirrors this grin, extending his hand to rest reassuringly on the Colonel's shoulder. In a spontaneous moment, the Colonel closes his eyes, leaning in to kiss Lester, an act that leaves Lester momentarily stunned, prompting him to react instinctively by pushing the Colonel away. The Colonel, his face a mask of shame, stares down at the floor, blinking as emotions flit across his features, before he turns abruptly and bolts, escaping into the night through the open garage door, where the rain swallows him into its murky depths. Back in the car, Carolyn remains enveloped in the cocoon of the motivational tape, the Glock resting familiarly in her hand, until she reaches over to switch the tape off, placing the gun into her purse with a practiced motion. The Mercedes, its engine now purring, pulls away from the shoulder, dissolving into the stream of traffic. Meanwhile, Lester enters the house, his steps deliberate as he makes his way to the kitchen. With an easy familiarity, he opens the refrigerator, the cool air washing over him as he retrieves a beer, deftly popping the top before he heads towards the family room. Once there, he leans casually against the wall, bringing the bottle to his lips for a swig as we move smoothly around a corner. Angela comes into view beside the stereo, her posture marked by the subtle indicators of her recent tears, visible in her puffy face and mussed hair. She regards us with a mix of apprehension and unsteady composure, her expression transforming into a slightly defiant smile as she attempts to reclaim a semblance of confidence. Angela continues to smile as Lester gestures with the bottle, lifting it to her mouth and allowing her to drink, albeit somewhat clumsily. As the moment lingers, he tenderly wipes her chin with the back of his hand, a gesture of care amidst the unfolding drama.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
The Colonel coldly surveys us from Ricky's bedroom window before closing the drapes. As rain and traffic pass by, Carolyn sits in her car, listening to a motivational tape, retrieves her Glock from the glove compartment, and places it in her purse after turning off the tape. Meanwhile, Jane opens the door for Ricky, prompting Angela to exit the room in a huff. Jane embraces Ricky as Angela runs down the stairs, visibly upset. 

We then shift focus to the Burnham's garage, where Lester, in sweatpants, performs bench presses while the Colonel watches intently. After Lester finishes, he and the Colonel lock eyes through the window. As rain pours down with thunder, the Colonel cautiously approaches Lester and shares an unexpected kiss. Surprised, Lester pushes him away, causing the Colonel to flee in shame into the rainy night.

Inside, Lester retrieves a beer from the fridge and heads to the family room. He leans against the wall, taking a swig, as Angela appears, having been crying but attempting a defiant smile. Lester offers her the beer, wiping her chin gently after she takes a drink.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: The Colonel, a retired military officer known for his strict demeanor and adherence to discipline, looks coldly down at us from Ricky's bedroom window, then pulls the drapes shut. Cars, likely commuting home on a typical busy suburban street, zoom past in the rain while Carolyn, a real estate agent who often listens to self-help materials to boost her career motivation, sits behind the wheel, listening to a motivational tape on the stereo. Carolyn leans over, opens the glove compartment of her luxury sedan, and takes out her Glock, a popular handgun model often chosen for its reliability and ease of use. Jane, Ricky's school friend who harbors a quiet admiration for him, stands across the room, and Angela, known for her effortless beauty that often draws attention, is sprawled across the bed as there is a knock on the door. Jane jumps up, opens the door, and lets him in. Angela stares at him, stunned by his sudden appearance, then starts toward the door and exits, slamming the door behind her with a sense of frustration. Jane turns to Ricky, and he takes her in his arms as a comforting gesture. Angela sits on the stairs, shaken by the encounter and crying over the complexities of her emotions. We move slowly toward the Burnham's garage window, where Lester, a man experiencing a midlife crisis and attempting to regain his physical fitness, wearing only his sweatpants, is performing bench presses, while the Colonel stands outside, watching with a curious intensity. We zoom slowly in on the Colonel as he watches, transfixed by Lester's effort. Lester finishes his last rep, racks the weights, sits up sweaty and out of breath, then glances at us, aware he's being watched by the Colonel. Lester and the Colonel stare at each other through the window as we're directly outside the garage door, slowly revealing Lester smiling at us, perhaps in recognition of a shared secret. The rain comes down in sheets with a sharp clap of thunder, emphasizing the dramatic tension. The Colonel moves stiffly, seems preoccupied and slightly disoriented by his own emotions, and just stands there looking at Lester before moving closer and grinning. Lester grins as well and places his hand on the Colonel's shoulder in a reassuring gesture. The Colonel closes his eyes and then kisses him, an unexpected act revealing deep, hidden feelings. Lester is momentarily stunned by the bold move and then pushes the Colonel away, caught off guard by the advance. The Colonel's face crumples in shame as he stares at the floor, blinking, then turns and runs out the open garage door into the rainy night, overwhelmed by his own actions. Carolyn is still listening to the same motivational tape, the Glock in her hand symbolizing her inner turmoil, before she switches the tape off and puts the gun in her purse, as if trying to regain control over her chaotic emotions. The Mercedes, synonymous with her successful yet stressful lifestyle, pulls away from the shoulder. Lester enters, opens the refrigerator, grabs a beer, opens it, and starts toward the family room, seeking solace in the familiar comforts of his home. Lester leans against the wall and takes a swig of his beer, a moment of quiet introspection. As we move slowly around a corner, Angela comes into view, standing at the stereo, holding a CD case with music that offers some form of emotional release. She's been crying; her face is puffy, and her hair is mussed, a testament to her recent distress. She regards us apprehensively, then puts on a slightly defiant smile, masking her vulnerability. Angela smiles as Lester holds the bottle up to her mouth and she drinks clumsily, sharing an intimate yet complex moment. He gently wipes her chin with the back of his hand, a tender action signifying care amidst the chaos.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: The Colonel looks coldly down at us from Ricky's bedroom window then pulls the drapes shut. Cars zoom past in the rain while Carolyn sits behind the wheel listening to a motivational tape on the stereo. Carolyn leans over opens the glove compartment and takes out her Glock. Jane stands across the room and Angela is sprawled across the bed as there is a knock on the door. Jane jumps up opens the door and let us him in. Angela stares at him stunned then starts toward the door and exits slamming the door behind her. Jane turns to Ricky and he takes her in his arms. Angela sits on the stairs shaken and crying. We move slowly toward the Burnham's garage window through the rain. Through the window we see Lester wearing only his sweatpants performing bench presses and the Colonel standing outside watching. We zoom slowly in on the Colonel as he watches transfixed. Lester finishes his last rep racks the weights sits up sweaty and out of breath and then glances at us aware he is being watched. Lester and the Colonel stare at each other through the window as we are directly outside the garage door slowly revealing Lester smiling at us. The rain comes down in sheets with a sharp clap of thunder. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. The Colonel moves stiffly seems preoccupied and slightly disoriented and just stands there looking at Lester before moving closer and grinning. Lester grins as well and places his hand on the Colonel's shoulder. The Colonel closes his eyes and then kisses him. Lester is momentarily stunned and then pushes the Colonel away. The Colonel's face crumples in shame as he stares at the floor blinking then turns and runs out the open garage door into the rainy night. Carolyn is still listening to the same motivational tape holding the Glock in her hand before she switches the tape off and puts the gun in her purse. The Mercedes pulls away from the shoulder. Lester enters opens the refrigerator grabs a beer opens it and starts toward the family room. Lester leans against the wall and takes a swig of his beer. As we move slowly around a corner Angela comes into view standing at the stereo holding a CD case. She is been crying her face is puffy and her hair is mussed. She regards us apprehensively then puts on a slightly defiant smile. Angela smiles as Lester holds the bottle up to her mouth and she drinks clumsily. He gently wipes her chin with the back of his hand.

Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. The Colonel moves stiffly seems preoccupied and slightly disoriented and just stands there looking at Lester before moving closer and grinning. Lester grins as well and places his hand on the Colonel's shoulder. The Colonel closes his eyes and then kisses him. Lester is momentarily stunned and then pushes the Colonel away. The Colonel's face crumples in shame as he stares at the floor blinking then turns and runs out the open garage door into the rainy night. Carolyn is still listening to the same motivational tape holding the Glock in her hand before she switches the tape off and puts the gun in her purse. The Mercedes pulls away from the shoulder. Lester enters opens the refrigerator grabs a beer opens it and starts toward the family room. Lester leans against the wall and takes a swig of his beer. As we move slowly around a corner Angela comes into view standing at the stereo holding a CD case. She is been crying her face is puffy and her hair is mussed. She regards us apprehensively then puts on a slightly defiant smile. Angela smiles as Lester holds the bottle up to her mouth and she drinks clumsily. He gently wipes her chin with the back of his hand.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: The Colonel looks coldly down at us from Ricky's bedroom window then pulls the drapes shut. Cars zoom past in the rain while Carolyn sits behind the wheel listening to a motivational tape on the stereo. Carolyn leans over opens the glove compartment and takes out her Glock. Jane stands across the room and Angela is sprawled across the bed as there is a knock on the door. Jane jumps up opens the door and let us him in. Angela stares at him stunned then starts toward the door and exits slamming the door behind her. Jane turns to Ricky and he takes her in his arms. Lester enters opens the refrigerator grabs a beer opens it and starts toward the family room. Lester leans against the wall and takes a swig of his beer. As we move slowly around a corner Angela comes into view standing at the stereo holding a CD case. She is been crying her face is puffy and her hair is mussed. She regards us apprehensively then puts on a slightly defiant smile. Angela smiles as Lester holds the bottle up to her mouth and she drinks clumsily. He gently wipes her chin with the back of his hand.

Cars zoom past in the rain while Carolyn sits behind the wheel listening to a motivational tape on the stereo. Carolyn leans over opens the glove compartment and takes out her Glock. She regards us apprehensively then puts on a slightly defiant smile. Angela smiles as Lester holds the bottle up to her mouth and she drinks clumsily. He gently wipes her chin with the back of his hand.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The Librarian glares warmly up at them from Victor's rooftop chimney, then yanks the curtains wide. Planes soar by in the snow while Madison stands beneath the umbrella, humming a mysterious song on the guitar. Madison straightens up, closes the kitchen drawer, and extracts her ukulele. Cindy dances beside the couch, and Monica is curled under the table as there is a ring on the telephone. Cindy leaps down, closes the telephone, and lets the cat out. Monica glances at the cat, amazed, then drifts toward the telephone and answers, singing the telephone behind her. Cindy turns to Victor, and he holds her in his suitcase. Monica lies on the roof, rattled and whispering. They drift quickly away from the Smith's attic mirror through the snow. Through the mirror, they observe George, wearing only his pajamas, performing cartwheels, and the Librarian standing inside, listening. They zoom quickly out from the Librarian as he listens, enthralled. George completes his first jump, drops the dumbbells, stands up dry and full of energy, and then peers at them, surprised he's listening. George and the Librarian listen to each other through the mirror as they're diagonally inside the attic window, quickly hiding George giggling at them. The snow rises up in rivers with a quiet gust of wind. The Librarian plays loosely, seems distracted and slightly amused, and just rests silently staring at George before playing quieter and frowning. George frowns softly and places his elbow on the Librarian's knee. The Librarian opens his mouth and then whispers to him. George is briefly amazed and then pulls the Librarian closer. The Librarian's mouth stretches in pride as he gazes at the ceiling, laughing, then whispers and crawls in the closed attic window into the snowy evening. Madison is still humming the same mysterious song, holding the ukulele in her lap, before she strums the song on and shoves the ukulele in her pocket. The skateboard glides past from the driveway. George emerges, ties the backpack, grabs a soda, closes it, and floats away from the laundry room. George leans beside the sofa and takes a glimpse of his soda. As they drift quickly behind a painting, Monica skips out of view, leaping at the television, eating an apple pie. She's been laughing; her face is brilliant, and her hat is tidy. She ponders them hopefully, then puts on a very shy grin. Monica grins as George lifts the shoe up to her nose and she sniffs happily. He carelessly wipes her cheek with the palm of his shoe.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: The Colonel peers coldly from Ricky's window and closes the drapes. Outside, Carolyn listens to a motivational tape and takes out her Glock. Jane opens the door, allowing Angela to leave angrily, while Ricky comforts Jane. Angela, upset, sits on the stairs. In the garage, Lester, in sweatpants, bench presses as the Colonel watches. Their eyes meet, and the Colonel, seemingly disoriented, approaches and kisses Lester, who is stunned and pushes him away. The Colonel, ashamed, exits into the rain. Carolyn, still listening to her tape, puts the Glock in her purse before driving off. Lester grabs a beer from the fridge and leans against the wall. Angela, tearful and disheveled, appears at the stereo, forces a smile, and shares a drink with Lester, who gently wipes her chin.
